data.title: Amy Winehouse Foundation gives to Dreyfoos School
authors: Jane Fetterly, Palm Beach Daily News
data.meta_description: The legacy of celebrated singer and songwriter Amy Winehouse will be remembered at the Dreyfoos School of the Arts. \n Mitch and Janis Winehouse, parents of the late singer, and Paul Rubin , executive…
data.text:
The legacy of celebrated singer and songwriter Amy Winehouse will be remembered at the Dreyfoos School of the Arts.

Mitch and Janis Winehouse, parents of the late singer, and Paul Rubin, executive director of the Amy Winehouse Foundation, presented $50,000 to the Dreyfoos School of the Arts Foundation.

The grant will establish Amy’s Light Fund to support disadvantaged music and musical theater students. “We are excited and grateful for the opportunities this fund will provide our students,” said Kris Lidinsky, Dreyfoos Foundation executive director.

Attending the check presentation were principal Susan Atherley and foundation board members Patrick Cousins, Bill Fritz and Brandon Levine.

The Winehouse Foundation also works to prevent drug and alcohol misuse by young adults.

*

Executive director — The Friedman Commission for Jewish Education announces that Penny Beers, a member of the CJE board of directors, has been named executive director. She will start Sept. 1.

For the last 14 years, she worked for textbook companies as a sales and implementation consultant.

“Her long experience as a classroom teacher, administrator and consultant make her uniquely suited to serve as our new executive director,” said Cynnie S. List, CJE board president.

*

Palm Beach Business Group — Carl Domino and Rick Kozell, Republican candidates for Congressional District 18, will debate each other at 7:45 a.m. Friday at The Chesterfield.

Members pay $25; guests, $35.

For reservations, contact Tom Ross, group president, at tross@pbbusinessgroup.com or call 820-1579.

*

Flagler Rotary Club — Rotary District Gov. Eric Gordon will speak at 7:45 a.m. Tuesday at The Chesterfield. The breakfast cost is $21.

For information, contact Colleen Parkey at 236-7198.

*

Palm Beach Rotary — Resident RiccardoBoehm, who has a store on Antique Row in West Palm Beach, will speak on Guatemala at noon Thursday at The Chesterfield.

The luncheon cost is $35.

For information, contact Colleen Parkey at 236-7198.

*

Educator to talk — Robert Avossa, Palm Beach County schools superintendent, will speak on “The Importance of Early Childhood Education” at 11 a.m. Aug. 18 at the West Palm Beach Marriott, 1001 Okeechobee Blvd.

Avossa was named district superintendent in June 2015.

Participants in a panel discussion following the talk will include: Warren Eldridge, CEO of the Early Learning Coalition of Palm Beach County; Dave Lawrence Jr., chairman of The Children’s Movement of Florida, and Lisa Williams-Taylor, CEO of the Children’s Services Council of Palm Beach County.

The event is sponsored by the Central Palm Beach County Chamber of Commerce.
